PC Number Date Chapter Bill Dept
 1991-02971991-02-140,  ,  ,  IA&ND,  ,  , 
PrecisAuthority (a) to enter into a "SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT" with the Stoney Tribe of Indians, in the Province of Alberta (composed of the Bearspaw, Chiniki and Goodstoney Bands), which will resolve specific claims pertaining to the sub-surface mineral rights on reserve land situate at Ghost Lake, Alberta, which were surrendered in 1929; and (b) to accept an "Instrument of Absolute Surrender" concerning those rights.
Attachments
